item.title: noaa - Integrated Surface Database data
item.description: I’ve recently made some improvements to the functions that work with ISD (Integrated Surface Database) data. isd data The isd() function now caches more intelligently. We now cache using .rds files via saveRDS/readRDS, whereas we used to use .csv files, which take up much more disk space, and we have to worry about not changing data formats on reading data back into an R session. This has the downside that you can’t just go directly to open up a cached file in your favorite spreadsheet viewer, but you can do that manually after reading in to R.
